meanings.definition: In a way that causes feelings of discomfort or anxiety in confined or crowded spaces.
meanings.sent1: She felt claustrophobically trapped in the crowded elevator.
meanings.sent2: He avoided the small room claustrophobically, preferring open spaces.
meanings.sent3: The cat comically acted claustrophobically when placed in a tiny box.
meanings.sent4: The narrow alley closed in claustrophobically around him, making him uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog pressed claustrophobically against the windows, obscuring the view.

meanings.definition: In a manner that suggests a fear of enclosed spaces.
meanings.sent1: She walked claustrophobically through the narrow tunnel, feeling anxious.
meanings.sent2: He breathed deeply, trying to calm his claustrophobically racing heart.
meanings.sent3: The clown amusingly pretended to act claustrophobically scared of the tiny car.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the cave closed in claustrophobically, triggering his fear.
meanings.sent5: The walls of the room seemed to move claustrophobically closer, intensifying his panic.
